answers.text: a period of increasing division in the country based on the growth of slavery

qas.question: When did the civil was begin?
When was the Antebellum age considered to have begun?
What did The Antebellum age mark?

answers.text: the transition of American manufacturing to the industrial revolution.

context: The Antebellum Age was <a0_0>a period of increasing division in the country based on the growth of slavery<a0_0/> in the American South and in the western territories of Kansas and Nebraska that eventually lead to the Civil War in <a1_0>1861<a1_0/>. The Antebellum Period is often considered to have begun <a2_0>with the Kansas–Nebraska Act of 1854<a2_0/>,[citation needed] although it may have begun as early as 1812. This period is also significant because it marked <a3_0>the transition of American manufacturing to the industrial revolution.<a3_0/>[citation needed]
